graph.coarsening

Class CoarsenerIEC

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.coarsening.Coarsener
      • graph.coarsening.CoarsenerIEC

  • public class CoarsenerIEC
extends Coarsener
    edge-based coarsener. Class is not thread-safe, and so should be protected by clients when used in a multi-threaded context.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2017

    Company:

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void coarsen()
      coarsen() performs the following loop until the number of unmatched nodes is less than a ratio of the original nodes: (1) we visit an unvisited node randomly; (2) we match it with the neighbor that yields the maximum value of arcs connecting weight * lamda + (1-lamda)*sum_of_weights_of_arcs_conn_common_nbors (3) we mark as visited both nodes that were matched of course.

      • coarsen

        public void coarsen()
             throws GraphException,
                    CoarsenerException,
                    ParallelException
        coarsen() performs the following loop until the number of unmatched nodes is less than a ratio of the original nodes: (1) we visit an unvisited node randomly; (2) we match it with the neighbor that yields the maximum value of arcs connecting weight * lamda + (1-lamda)*sum_of_weights_of_arcs_conn_common_nbors (3) we mark as visited both nodes that were matched of course. The result is a new "coarse" graph that can be accessed by a call to getCoarseGraph() (after this method completes). Notice that the pair <"ratio",Double val> must be in the _properties map of this object, defining the ratio of coarse nodes over fine nodes that must be reached for the process to stop. Same for the pair <"max_allowed_card",Integer num> that specifies the maximum cardinality allowed for any "fine-level" node in order to be considered for coarsening with other nodes. Same for the pair <"lamda",Double val> that specifies the value lambda in the expression in step (2) above.
        Specified by:
        coarsen in class Coarsener
        Throws:
        GraphException
        CoarsenerException - if coarsening couldn't proceed satisfactorily, ie couldn't reach desired compression ratio as specified in "ratio" key's value in properties
        ParallelException

      • getBestNbor

        private Node getBestNbor(java.lang.Integer pos)
        find the best neighbor that should be matched with node at position pos. The best neighbor is the one maximizing the value lamda*conn_arcs_weight + (1-lamda)*conn_nbors_weight where the second term takes into account the common nbors of the two neighboring nodes, and sums the weights along their connecting arcs (second order effect) assuming partition constraints and cardinality constraints are satisfied.
        Parameters:
        pos - Integer
        Returns:
        Node
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if a value for the key "lamda" (not "lambda") or for the key "max_allowed_card" is not present in the properties map of this object.

      • toString
